title: England poised to stick with George Ford at fly-half for World Cup final
text:
England look poised to retain the backline combination of George Ford, Owen Farrell and Manu Tuilagi for Saturday’s World Cup final against South Africa - despite the physicality of the Springboks’ side, including powerhouse centre Damian de Allende, who scored the decisive try in their semi-final victory over Wales last Sunday.

England head coach Eddie Jones had reshuffled his backline for the quarter-final because of the powerful presence of Australia centre Samu Kerevi, with Owen Farrell switching to fly-half, Henry Slade starting at 13 and George Ford tasked with finishing the game at fly-half from the bench.

However, as England prepared for their final major training session of the week...
description: England look poised to retain the backline combination of George Ford, Owen Farrell and Manu Tuilagi for Saturday’s World Cup final against South Africa - despite the physicality of the Springboks’ side, including powerhouse centre Damian de Allende, who scored the decisive try in their semi-final victory over Wales last Sunday.
